description: The article "Align The Misaligned" discusses the fragmentation of the internet, comparing it to geological processes. It explores the concept of ecosystem architecture, which views digital landscapes as complex systems. The piece examines different types of fragmentation, their historical context, and the perspectives of various stakeholders. It argues for embracing fragmentation as an opportunity for innovation and diversity, rather than attempting to restore a singular global internet.
excerpt: The internet has fragmented like tectonic shifts, and attempts to reunify it are futile. Ecosystem architecture views this as an opportunity, embracing diversity in digital landscapes. The article explores types of fragmentation, historical context, and stakeholder perspectives.
